alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 9:22PM CDT until May 31 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. .Water levels are gradually decreasing. Forecasts include observed precipitation as well as expected precipitation over the next 24 hours. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Harwood. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 86.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 87.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday was 87.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 81.4 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
